questions.answer_description:
✑ Events that ended more than 365 days ago
✑ Closed tasks created more than 365 days ago (if they have no due date)
Reference:
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=sf.activities_archived.htm&type=5

choices.D: Events that ended more than 365 days ago are archived.
choices.C: Archived activities are deleted after 365 days.
choices.A: Closed tasks created more than 365 days ago with no due date are archived.
choices.B: Events created more than 365 days ago are archived.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Events that ended more than 365 days ago
Closed tasks due more than 365 days ago
Closed tasks created more than 365 days ago (if they have no due date)

The two considerations an administrator should communicate regarding archived Activities are:

A. Closed tasks created more than 365 days ago with no due date are archived: Tasks that have been completed and have no due date that were created more than 365 days ago are archived. This means that they are no longer visible on the activity timeline of the associated record but are still accessible through the Activity History related list.

B. Events created more than 365 days ago are archived: Events that were created more than 365 days ago, including both past and future events, are archived. This means that they are no longer visible on the activity timeline of the associated record but are still accessible through the Activity History related list.

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks wants to understand the implications of archived Activities.
Which two considerations should an administrator communicate regarding archived Activities? (Choose two.)

choices.C: User B had the records manually shared with them.
choices.B: User B had the records shared with them through a Permission Set.
choices.D: User B is a member of a Queue that gained access to the records through a Sharing Rule.
choices.A: User B is a member of a Group that gained access to the records through a Sharing Rule.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers uses a Private Sharing model for Accounts. User A is onboarded to User B's team and given the same Profile and Role. Both users own 20
Accounts but User B is able to see 40 Accounts, whereas User A can only see the 20 they own.
What are two possible reasons for this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Permission set does not share records

questions.question_text: Which two deployment tools should be used to delete metadata from an organization? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
This is Wrong Answer- Change set cannot be used in deletion. 
https://salesforce.stackexchange.com/questions/41936/is-it-possible-to-remove-fields-using-change-sets-deployment
Why not D? Is ant a salesforce tool? What if there is an unmanaged package that lets you delete metadata?

The correct answer is A. Developer Console and B. Ant Migration Tool.

The Developer Console has an option to delete metadata components from an organization. It allows users to delete Apex classes, Visualforce pages, triggers, and other components from the organization.

The Ant Migration Tool can also be used to delete metadata components from an organization. The tool provides the "destructiveChanges.xml" file that lists the metadata components to be deleted.

Change sets and unmanaged packages are used to deploy metadata components to an organization, not to delete them.

Selected Answer: AB
The answer is A, B.

Selected Answer: AB
Changeset cannot delete

questions.question_text:
The HR Director at Universal Containers has indicated the picklist entries for salary range and pay grade on the custom Position object need updating and require frequent change. Because frequent changes have to be made to these Position fields, they are requesting the ability to update these picklist values.
Which feature should the administrator consider that allows for this?

choices.B: A permission set containing the modify all data permission for the Position object.
choices.D: Field accessibility set to editable for the picklists for the Position object.
choices.C: Delegated administration for the Position object.
choices.A: Screen Flow using custom metadata types.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer is C.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has an active process that assigns a task to sales operations once an opportunity is won. Sales Ops is reporting that the tasks are missing.
Which two tools should the administrator use to determine the problem? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A and D.

The administrator should use the Email Log to check if the email notification for the task was sent to the Sales Operations user. They should also check the Debug Log to see if any errors occurred during the process that may have caused the tasks to be missing.

Monitoring time-based workflows and checking the paused flow interview list would not be helpful in this scenario, as it is not related to workflow rules or flows.
i think it should be C.D
I don't see emails implications in this task. Perhaps monitor the time based workflow is needed to se if the workflow has scheduled the task creation and it will occurs in the future.
Why not C. Paused flow interview list? You can go check Setup-Process Automation-Paused And Failed Flow Interviews and if there is this process in paused.

How would a time based workflow be beneficial in this case? The status change of an opportunity to "Closed-won" does not have a definite time set in place. Some people believe the right answer is "Email log" but I don't believe it's this one either.

comments.content: Perhaps the rationale behind "Email log" is that in this active process, once a task is assigned, an email is sent out to Sales Ops informing them of the won opportunity. Since the tasks are missing, the first thing to do is check to see the emails are being sent out. So this is a possible explanation of why "Email Log" might be correct.
